Package javelin.model.unit

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.Monster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Cloneable
    public class Monster
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A Monster represents a stat-block (monster information) from the monster manual. Different in-game battle units can be linked to the same stat block. A player character creates it's own stat-block which is updated as he levels up. For performance, Monsters are not to be cloned during BattleNode replication. A monster should only be cloned and modified during AI thinking in the case a spell or ability changes that specific unit's stats (cat's grace or level drain, for example).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Monster types as per the SRD.

      • walk

        public int walk
        5 units = 1 square. A unit is able to move this number of squares as a move-equivalent action (.5 action points).
        See Also:
        fly

      • fly

        public int fly
        Flying allows an unit to ignore water and obstacles. A flying unit should have walk 0. Map.flying might prevent units from flying over obstacles (like undergound, where there's no "above" to fly over) - but it still allows for other benefits, such as ignoring water. TODO also offer perfect flight, which could at least charge through obstacles.
        See Also:
        walk

      • burrow

        public int burrow
        Burrow allows a creature to submerge into the earth. Normally they would be able to descend to any depth but due to AI and complexity concerns burrowing right is more restrict. Read "combatmodifiers.txt". Burrowing and surfacing cost the equivalent of a single square movement unless engaged.

      • swim

        public int swim
        A swimming creature is able to ignore water penalties and charge through flooded squares.
        See Also:
        walk

      • armor

        public int armor
        The portion of ac due to armor protection.

        See Also:

      • dr

        public int dr
        Damage reduction.

      • energyresistance

        public int energyresistance
        Energy resistance. Currently applied to everything that is not a physical attacks like melee, ranged and charge. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE means energy immunity.

      • sr

        public int sr
        Spell resistance. "To affect a creature that has spell resistance, a spellcaster must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) at least equal to the creatures spell resistance."

      • humanoid

        public java.lang.Boolean humanoid
        A monster is humanoid if it can use most of it's Slots to wear Artifacts. Humanoid and monstrous humanoid monster types are humanoid by default, other types have to manually marked as Humanoid="yes" in monster.xml to be marked as such. Ideally this would be defined in a slot-by-slot and monster-by-monster basis but for now a creature tagged as humanoid is eligible to use any and all Slots. What is or not a humanoid can be hard to determine in a fantasy game. Currently, if anything is any less than 90% human in form (and thus able to wear all Slots comfortably) then it isn't a proper humanoid.

      • nightonly

        public boolean nightonly
        Creatures that should only be spawned at night or underground.

      • immunitytocritical

        public boolean immunitytocritical
        Immunity to critical hits.

      • immunitytopoison

        public boolean immunitytopoison
        Immune to the effects of Poison.

      • immunitytoparalysis

        public boolean immunitytoparalysis
        If true cannot be affected by HoldMonster.

      • immunitytomind

        public boolean immunitytomind
        Immune to mind-affecting effects.

      • poison

        public int poison
        Temporary constitution damage. 1 poison = -1 temporary constitution score.

      • misschance

        public float misschance
        Percent chance of an attack missing (1 = 100%).

      • babpartial

        public float babpartial
        Since it's likely for units to advance in differnent classes instead of in a single one due to having Academy locations and only usually one class option at each, Base Attack Bonus is stored as a fraction if a ClassLevelUpgrade isn't enough to bring it to a new digit.

      • passive

        public boolean passive
        A passive combatant represents something other than a Monster. They usually don't act (at least in the normal sense) and have zero Challenge Rating.

      • internal

        public boolean internal
        true if this stat block shoudl'nt be used normally but is required for some internal game feature (examples being Settlers and Arena buildings).

      • heal

        public boolean heal
        true for most monster. Undead and Construct types don't heal naturally though.

      • constrict

        public Constrict constrict

      • ranks

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> ranks
        Counts skill ranks both from trained and untrained Skills. Untrained skill usually come from the base monster stats.

      • trained

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> trained
        Trained Skills are maximized every time a unit levels up.
        See Also:
        Skill.maximize(Monster), ClassLevelUpgrade, ranks

      • elite

        public boolean elite

      • alignment

        public Alignment alignment
        Lawful/chaotic and good/evil axis.

      • save

        public boolean save​(int bonus,
                    int dc)
        Rolls a d20 to determine a saving throw result. Note that for being random this can only be used outside of BattleAi thinking.
        Parameters:
        bonus - getfortitude(), getwill() or ref bonus. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE represents automatic success.
        dc - Difficulty class target for the saving roll.
        Returns:
        true on save success.

      • getbab

        public int getbab()
        Returns:
        Base attack bonus (0 or higher value).

      • changestrengthmodifier

        public void changestrengthmodifier​(int modifierchange)
        Parameters:
        modifierchange - Raises strength bonus by this many steps (+1 bonus = +2 score points)

      • changestrengthscore

        public void changestrengthscore​(int scorechange)
        Same as changestrengthmodifier(int) but receives a score change instead.

      • changedexteritymodifier

        public void changedexteritymodifier​(int modifierchange)
        Parameters:
        modifierchange - Raises dexterity bonus by +1 this many times (+1 bonus = +2 ability score points).

      • changedexterityscore

        public void changedexterityscore​(int scorechange)
        Same as changedexteritymodifier(int) but receives an ability score change instead. Assumes that the maximum dexterity bonus for the given armor is equal to (8-armor). This doesn't affect anything else besides allowing dexterity to improve AC or not, internally.

      • changeconstitutionmodifier

        public void changeconstitutionmodifier​(Combatant c,
                                       int modifierchange)
        Parameters:
        c - Raises constitution by +2...
        modifierchange - multiplied by this magnitude. Negative values allowed.
        Throws:
        Death - In case of zero or negative constitution.

      • changeconstitutionscore

        public void changeconstitutionscore​(Combatant c,
                                    int scorechange)
        Same as changeconstitutionmodifier(Combatant, int) but receives score point changes isntead of modifier changes (2 score points = 1 modifier change).

      • changeintelligencemodifier

        public void changeintelligencemodifier​(int modifierchange)
        Same as changeintelligencescore(int) but receives a score change instead (2 score points = 1 modifier point).

      • changeintelligencescore

        public void changeintelligencescore​(int scorechange)
        Should give players more points for Skills but instead just lower cr considering how far behind the unit is form where it should be - preventing all sorts of complications.
        Parameters:
        newscore - Raises intelligence by this many ability score points (+2 point = +1 bonus modifier).

      • changewisdommodifier

        public void changewisdommodifier​(int modifierchange)
        Same as changewisdomscore(int) but receives a modifier instead (1 positive or negative modifier change = 2 score change).

        public float size()

        Returns:

      • getfortitude

        public int getfortitude()
        Monsters such as Construct and Undead with 0 constitution always pass fortitude checks.
        Returns:
        The fortitude saving throw bonus of Integer.MAX_VALUE if immune.

      • think

        public boolean think​(int minimum)
        Parameters:
        minimum - Minimum intelligence bonus required. -1 or higher is primitive intelligence.
        Returns:
        true if able to communicate and think reasonably well. Being able to understand and follow simple, general tasks should do (which is not the case for animals that can only follow a few specific, well-trained tasks).

      • see

        public int see()
        Returns:
        a -0, -2 or -4 skill check penalty depending on time of day and Monster vision.
        See Also:
        Javelin.getperiod(), vision, Combatant.perceive(String), Combatant.view(String), Skills#perceive(Monster, boolean)

      • getterrains

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getterrains()
        Returns:
        All terrain types this monster can be found in. May be empty if this is an internal Javelin monster.
        See Also:
        Terrain.toString()
